mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Elizabeth Powel to Martha Washington, 1796 December 7
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Powel, Elizabeth Willing, 1743-1830
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Powel sends Mrs. Washington a bottle of Martinique Noyan medicine which the latter had used for the colic -- she suggests that "it would not be amiss if my good friend the President will take a glass on his return from the Congress"-- Powel believes "he will be not a little agitated" after what may be his last appearance before them (giving his 8th Annual address to Congress). Autograph letter signed, 1 page. Retained copy, watermark (powder horn). Name on original manuscript appears as "Eliz. Powel".
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Washington, Martha, 1731-1802
